name: 蘇益生
objective: In networked distributed storage, node failures are inevitable such that data may become unavailable. To maintain data integrity and fault tolerance, it is necessary to repair failed nodes in networked distributed storage. This course gives an introduction to coding techniques for repairability in networked distributed storage. This course includes a review of knowledge of error-correcting codes, and then examines the traditional erasure codes for networked distributed storage, code design for repairability, network codes on codes, codes on codes, locally repairable codes, and other relevant topics for repairability in networked distributed storage.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Networked Distributed Storage Systems
Week 3 & 4: Coding Preliminaries
Week 5:& 6: Erasure Codes for Networked Distributed Storage Systems
Week 7 & 8: Code Design for Repairability
Week 9: Midterm Exam
Week 10 & 11: Network Codes on Codes
Week 12 & 13: Codes on Codes
Week 14 & 15: Locally Repairable Codes
Week 16: Final Exam
Week 17 & 18: Paper Study

The course schedule is subject to change on the basis of class progress.
